title: Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history
author: alexmolas
aiHeadline: In a Mind-Blowing Feat of Mental Wizardry, 14-Year-Old Gukesh Becomes the Youngest Chess World Champion in History, Leaving All the Adults in the Room Wondering What They've Been Doing with Their Lives, and How They Can Start Over with a New Hobby That Doesn't Involve Getting Crushed by a Teenager at a Board Game

title: Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History
author: agilek
aiHeadline: Because You Clearly Had Nothing Better to Do with Your Time, Timemap.org Has Launched an Interactive Map of History, Allowing You to Waste Hours Clicking Through Centuries of Historical Events and Forgetting About All the Productive Things You Promised Yourself You'd Get Done Today, Like Laundry or Taxes

title: A ChatGPT clone, in 3000 bytes of C, backed by GPT-2 (2023)
author: chubot
aiHeadline: In a Bizarre Display of Masochism, Some Brave Soul Has Managed to Cram a ChatGPT Clone into a Mere 3000 Bytes of C Code, Backed by GPT-2, Because Who Needs Human Interaction or Sanity When You Can Have a Conversational AI That Can Fit on a Floppy Disk from the 90s?

title: BlenderGPT
author: handfuloflight
aiHeadline: BlenderGPT is Here to Revolutionize the World of 3D Modeling and Animation, or at Least That's What the Creators Claim, But Let's Be Real, It's Probably Just Going to Be Used to Generate Endless Amounts of CringeworthyAnimations of Dancing Robots and Overly-Attached GFs

title: Fermat's Last Theorem – how it's going
author: verbify
aiHeadline: Fermat's Last Theorem, the Mathematical Problem That Has Haunted Mathematicians for Centuries, is Still Going Strong, with a New Update from the Xena Project, Because What's a Few More Decades of Number-Crunching and Theorem-Proving When You're on the Brink of a Breakthrough That Could Change the Face of Mathematics Forever, or at Least Get You a Decent Paper Published in a Reputable Journal?
